com.jdroid.android.billing
Interface BillingManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
BillingManagerImpl, MockBillingManager
public interface BillingManager

Author:
Maxi Rosson

Method Detail

checkBillingSupported

boolean checkBillingSupported()
Checks if in-app billing is supported.

Returns:
false if there was an error connecting the Google Play app

restoreTransactions

boolean restoreTransactions()
Requests transaction information for all managed items. Call this only when the application is first installed or after a database wipe. Do NOT call this every time the application starts up.

Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app

confirmNotifications

boolean confirmNotifications(String... notifyIds)
Confirms receipt of a purchase state change. Each notifyId is an opaque identifier that came from the server. This method sends those identifiers back to the MarketBillingService, which ACKs them to the server. Returns false if there was an error trying to connect to the MarketBillingService.

Parameters:
notifyIds - a list of opaque identifiers associated with purchase state changes.
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app

requestPurchase

boolean requestPurchase(Purchasable purchasable,
                        String developerPayload)
Requests that the given item be offered to the user for purchase. When the purchase succeeds (or is canceled) the BillingReceiver receives an intent with the action BillingReceiver.ACTION_NOTIFY. Returns false if there was an error trying to connect to the Google Play app.

Parameters:
purchasable - the product to purchase
developerPayload - a payload that is associated with a given purchase, if null, no payload is sent
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app

bind

void bind(android.content.Context context)

unbind

void unbind()
Unbinds from the MarketBillingService. Call this when the application terminates to avoid leaking a ServiceConnection.

getPurchaseInformation

boolean getPurchaseInformation(String[] notifyIds)
Gets the purchase information. This message includes a list of notification IDs sent to us by the Google Play app, which we include in our request. The server responds with the purchase information, encoded as a JSON string, and sends that to the BillingReceiver in an intent with the action BillingReceiver.ACTION_PURCHASE_STATE_CHANGED. Returns false if there was an error trying to connect to the MarketBillingService.

Parameters:
notifyIds - a list of opaque identifiers associated with purchase state changes
Returns:
false if there was an error connecting to the Google Play app

purchaseStateChanged

void purchaseStateChanged(String signedData,
                          String signature)
Verifies that the data was signed with the given signature, and calls BillingListener.onPurchased(PurchaseOrder), BillingListener.onRefunded(PurchaseOrder) or BillingListener.onCanceled(PurchaseOrder) for each verified purchase.

Parameters:
signedData - the signed JSON string (signed, not encrypted)
signature - the signature for the data, signed with the private key

checkResponseCode

void checkResponseCode(long requestId,
                       BillingResponseCode responseCode)
This is called when we receive a response code from the Google Play app for a request that we made. This is used for reporting various errors and for acknowledging that an order was sent to the server. This is NOT used for any purchase state changes. All purchase state changes are received in the BillingReceiver and passed to this service, where they are handled in purchaseStateChanged(String, String).

Parameters:
requestId - a number that identifies a request, assigned at the time the request was made to the Google Play app
responseCode - a response code from the Google Play app to indicate the state of the request

register

void register(BillingListener billingListener)
Registers a listener to listen events

Parameters:
billingListener - the listener to register

unregister

void unregister(BillingListener billingListener)
Unregisters a previously registered listener.

Parameters:
billingListener - the previously registered listener.

register

void register(PurchaseObserver observer)
Registers an observer to listen events

Parameters:
observer - the observer to register

unregister

void unregister(PurchaseObserver observer)
Unregisters a previously registered observer.

Parameters:
observer - the previously registered observer.
